review_text:
The rental is certainly nice enough for a short stay, and I commend the owner for its cleanliness. The beds & linens were comfortable as well, and check in and check out were both very easy and nicely arranged, but this rental is a bit bare bones and awkward. While the owner could easily add packets of sugar and sweetener, and add trash cans to the bedrooms, the rest of the less-than-ideal aspects of this rental property are not as easily appeased by the owner.
It is not easy to traverse through the rooms on the first floor because of a strange step-up at the base of the stairs to the second floor that cuts the first floor in half (living room vs dining-kitchen-bathroom area). There is a half-bath downstairs, but it has no air vent for AC/heating, which means it is cold in the winter and hot in the summer. There were no hand towels in the downstairs half-bath, and no racks on which to hang any towels - though this was solved easily enough with a roll of paper towels from the kitchen. The upstairs full bath also lacks sufficient towel racks, though the owner has done what they can to add space for hanging towels outside of the upstairs bathroom. The ceiling fan in the Master Bedroom has only 1 actual speed= too fast, vs off. The chain has more pulls, suggesting you might be able to acquire more speeds by pulling the chain again, but in truth, the fan was either very fast or off. No medium or low speeds. There was one and only one trash can upstairs - in the bathroom shared by the two bedrooms. No trash cans in either bedroom, and thus no access to a trashcan when someone is in the bathroom. A neighbor allowed their little yippy dog to bark more than I cared for. The view of trees and birds out the eating area window was nice; the lawn in the back is crabgrass and weeds, not grass. It's a shared lawn, so again, the quality of the lawn is not something the rental owner can easily address.
Summary - appreciably clean, and relatively low cost to rent for the location, but it has an awkward floorplan and suffers from lower-end construction construction and property management issues (squeaky floors when people walk upstairs, odd step-up that divides the ground floor but saves space, weeds for lawn). Nice enough rental, and the owner has provided most (not quite all) of the conveniences I've come to expect from an Airbnb, but I'm glad I don't live long-term in this place with trip-hazard floorplan and cheap construction.
